resources.description: Water Transparency (Diffuse attenuation coefficient at 490nm, Kd490 in m-1): The diffuse attenuation coefficient Kd490 measures the light penetration in the water column at the blue-green wavelengths (ca. 490 nm). It represents a good indicator of water transparency resulting from the combined action of absorption and backscattering by the water constituents, and the structure of the surrounding light field.
resources.name: EMIS - MODIS-AQUA Monthly mean sea surface diffuse attenuation coefficient (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR in Einstein.m-2.day-1): PAR is defined as the quantum energy flux from the sun in the spectral range 400 to 700 nm, usable in the process of photosynthesis by phytoplankton, benthic algae and seagrass.
resources.name: EMIS - SeaWiFS Monthly mean photosynthetically available radiation (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Water Transparency (Diffuse attenuation coefficient at 490nm, Kd490 in m-1): The diffuse attenuation coefficient Kd490 measures the light penetration in the water column at the blue-green wavelengths (ca. 490 nm). It represents a good indicator of water transparency resulting from the combined action of absorption and backscattering by the water constituents, and the structure of the surrounding light field.
resources.name: EMIS - SeaWiFS Monthly mean sea surface diffuse attenuation coefficient (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR in Einstein.m-2.day-1): PAR is defined as the quantum energy flux from the sun in the spectral range 400 to 700 nm, usable in the process of photosynthesis by phytoplankton, benthic algae and seagrass.
resources.name: EMIS - SeaWiFS Monthly mean photosynthetically available radiation (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Algal biomass (chlorophyll concentration, Chla in mg.m-3): Chlorophyll is a photosynthetic pigment commonly present in all phytoplankton species. It is used as a proxy for phytoplankton biomass. Chlorophyll concentration is a standard product from satellite-based optical sensors, usually retrieved from empirical algorithms using reflectance ratios at two or more wavebands.
resources.name: EMIS - MERIS Monthly mean sea surface Chlorophyll-a concentration (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Absorption Coefficient of colored detrital matter at 443nm (adg in m-1): The absorption coefficient adg represents the fraction of incident light absorbed by both detrital particles and colored dissolved organic matter (CDOM). Dissolved organic matter is an important component of the oceanic carbon cycle. It is also used as proxy to assess the impact of terrigenous inputs in coastal waters.
resources.name: EMIS - MERIS Monthly mean absorption coefficient due to chromophoric dissolved organic matter and non-pigmented particles (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Algal biomass (chlorophyll concentration, Chla in mg.m-3): Chlorophyll is a photosynthetic pigment commonly present in all phytoplankton species. It is used as a proxy for phytoplankton biomass. Chlorophyll concentration is a standard product from satellite-based optical sensors, usually retrieved from empirical algorithms using reflectance ratios at two or more wavebands.
resources.name: EMIS - SeaWiFS Monthly mean sea surface Chlorophyll-a concentration (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

Chlorophyll concentration is a standard product from satellite-based optical sensors, usually retrieved from empirical algorithms using reflectance ratios at two or more wavebands.
resources.name: EMIS - MERIS 8Day mean sea surface Chlorophyll-a concentration (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Algal biomass (chlorophyll concentration, Chla in mg.m-3): Chlorophyll is a photosynthetic pigment commonly present in all phytoplankton species. It is used as a proxy for phytoplankton biomass. Chlorophyll concentration is a standard product from satellite-based optical sensors, usually retrieved from empirical algorithms using reflectance ratios at two or more wavebands.
resources.name: EMIS - MODIS-AQUA Monthly mean sea surface Chlorophyll-a concentration (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Sea surface temperature (SST in degree-C): Sea surface temperature is the temperature of the water close to the sea surface. SST is a standard product from satellite-based thermal infra-red sensors, and optical sensors complemented with infrared bands.
resources.name: EMIS - PATHFINDER Monthly mean sea surface temperature (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Surface productive layer (zeu in m): The surface productive layer or euphotic zone represents the upper part of the water column that is illuminated by the sun down to the one percent light level. It is a surface layer where most of the primary production occurs.
resources.name: EMIS - MERIS Monthly mean surface productive layer (Euphotic Depth) (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Absorption Coefficient of Phytoplankton at 443nm (aph in m-1): The absorption coefficient aph represents the fraction of incident light absorbed by phytoplankton organisms. It is an index of variability of the phytoplankton biomass in marine and coastal turbid waters.
resources.name: EMIS - MODIS-AQUA Monthly mean absorption coefficient due to phytoplankton (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Particulate matter (particulate backscatter coefficient at 443 nm, bbp in m-1): The backscatter coefficient bbp represents the fraction of incident light that is scattered backward from its original path. The backscattering coefficient gives a good indication of the concentration of suspended organic and inorganic particles (e.g. sediments) in the water.
resources.name: EMIS - MERIS Monthly mean particulate backscattering coefficient (2km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Surface productive layer (zeu in m): The surface productive layer or euphotic zone represents the upper part of the water column that is illuminated by the sun down to the one percent light level. It is a surface layer where most of the primary production occurs.
resources.name: EMIS - Monthly mean surface productive layer (Euphotic Depth) (2km): - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.

resources.description: Algal biomass (chlorophyll concentration, Chla in mg.m-3): Chlorophyll is a photosynthetic pigment commonly present in all phytoplankton species. It is used as a proxy for phytoplankton biomass. Chlorophyll concentration is a standard product from satellite-based optical sensors, usually retrieved from empirical algorithms using reflectance ratios at two or more wavebands.

resources.description: Water productivity (primary production, pp in gCarbon.m-2.day-1): The primary production represents the amount of organic carbon produced through phytoplankton photosynthesis. It is a critical element of the Earth's carbon budget and the marine food web. The depth-integrated primary production is modeled from the satellite-based phytoplankton biomass concentration and PAR.
resources.name: EMIS - SeaWiFS Monthly mean primary production (4km) - NB: A GIS client is required to access and use this distribution.
